articles.content:
Troop Dispatch to Iraq Blasted 
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland in a statement on Saturday bitterly denounced the south Korean authorities and ultra-right conservative forces for their moves to dispatch combat troops to Iraq as an unpardonable act against the nation.
 Their moves for the troop dispatch to Iraq is a serious issue directly related to the dignity, interests and honor of the entire Korean nation, he said, strongly protesting against their moves and demanding they unconditionally cancel their reckless plan to sacrifice Koreans in the proxy war of the U.S. as its shockbrigade.    
 He urged the south Korean authorities to ponder over the grave consequences to be entailed by the dispatch of young and middle-aged Koreans to the land of death as the U.S. is also reluctant to send more combat forces there and react to the U.S. pressure with resistance based on national independence. He called upon the south Korean people to turn out as one in the struggle to resolutely reject and check the criminal plan to drive their beloved sons to death and protect the dignity and honor of the nation.
